segment.source: How to Set Up or Disable Database Size
segment.target: How to Set Up or Disable Database Size

segment.source: How to Set Up or Disable Database Size
segment.target: How to Set Up or Disable Database Size

segment.source: How to Set Up or Disable Database Size
segment.target: How to Set Up or Disable Database Size

segment.source: You can use the following procedures in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console to specify the size (in MB) of Application Virtualization System usage that you want to store in the database.
segment.target: You can use the following procedures in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console to specify the size (in MB) of Application Virtualization System usage that you want to store in the database.

segment.source: When the size of the stored data reaches 95% (the high watermark) of the specified limit, the system will delete 10% of the usage data, leaving 85% of the data.
segment.target: When the size of the stored data reaches 95% (the high watermark) of the specified limit, the system will delete 10% of the usage data, leaving 85% of the data.

segment.source: Package and application usage data will be deleted.
segment.target: Package and application usage data will be deleted.

segment.source: When the database grows large enough and approaches the high watermark, a warning message is sent to the SQL Server log to inform you that this limit has been reached.
segment.target: When the database grows large enough and approaches the high watermark, a warning message is sent to the SQL Server log to inform you that this limit has been reached.

segment.source: This warning is necessary because the cleanup action can affect the output of the reports.
segment.target: This warning is necessary because the cleanup action can affect the output of the reports.

segment.source: It will also help you decide whether you need to increase the maximum database size, reduce the number of months of usage data to be kept, or turn down the logging level.
segment.target: It will also help you decide whether you need to increase the maximum database size, reduce the number of months of usage data to be kept, or turn down the logging level.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The No Size Limit and Keep All Usage options are provided so that you can disable usage reporting and database cleanup.
segment.target: The No Size Limit and Keep All Usage options are provided so that you can disable usage reporting and database cleanup.

segment.source: Selecting these items will clean up the database transaction log as well.
segment.target: Selecting these items will clean up the database transaction log as well.

segment.source: (All committed Microsoft SQL Server transactions will be removed from the database log.)
segment.target: (All committed Microsoft SQL Server transactions will be removed from the database log.)

segment.source: To set up database size
segment.target: To set up database size

segment.source: Right-click the Application Virtualization System node in the left pane, and select System Options.
segment.target: Right-click the Application Virtualization System node in the left pane, and select System Options.

segment.source: Select the Database tab.
segment.target: Select the Database tab.

segment.source: Select the Maximum Database Size (MB) or No Size Limit radio button.
segment.target: Select the Maximum Database Size (MB) or No Size Limit radio button.

segment.source: If you choose to specify a database size, best practices recommend that you enter a number between 512 and 4096 MB.
segment.target: If you choose to specify a database size, best practices recommend that you enter a number between 512 and 4096 MB.

segment.source: The default size is 1024 MB and if you need to increase the database size, the maximum value you can enter is 2,147,483,647.
segment.target: The default size is 1024 MB and if you need to increase the database size, the maximum value you can enter is 2,147,483,647.

segment.source: If you select No Size Limit, the database will grow until it reaches the disk size limit.
segment.target: If you select No Size Limit, the database will grow until it reaches the disk size limit.

segment.source: Click Apply or OK.
segment.target: Click Apply or OK.

segment.source: To disable database size limits
segment.target: To disable database size limits

segment.source: Right-click the Application Virtualization System node in the Scope pane, and select System Options.
segment.target: Right-click the Application Virtualization System node in the Scope pane, and select System Options.

segment.source: Select the Database tab.
segment.target: Select the Database tab.

segment.source: Select the No Size Limit and Keep All Usage radio buttons.
segment.target: Select the No Size Limit and Keep All Usage radio buttons.

segment.source: Click Apply or OK.
segment.target: Click Apply or OK.
